Nos. 6201 of 2016 & 1192 of 2014 Dated this the 3" day of October, 2016 ORDER These applications are filed by the complainant in CC No.590/2010 and 480/2011 of the Judicial 1%* Class Magistrate Court, Kunnamkulam. CC No.480/2011 arises from Crime No.119/1990 of Vadakkekad Police Station and Crl.M.C. No. 1192/2014 relates to that crime. The grievance of the petitioner in Crl.M.C. No.6201/2016 is that, the disposal of the cases is getting delayed. According to the petitioner, while the trial in CC No. 590/2010 had reached its fag end, the 5 respondent herein filed an application for simultaneous trial along with CC No.480/2011. It was allowed by Annexure-IX order. The petitioner apprehends thai, it will further delay the proceedings. 2. The learned Magistrate on a direction from this Court has informed, by communication dated 27.09.2016 that, C.C. Nos.590/2010 and 480/2011 are being proceeded with and both the cases can be disposed of within a period of 6 months time. Having regard to this, | feel that, the request made by the learned Magistrate is reasonable. Hence, | am inclined to dispose of both the Crl.M.Cs. with a direction that, the court below shall mo) 2016/KER/42226 Cri. M. C. Nos. 6201 of 2016 & 1192 of 2014 2 dispose of the matters, at the earliest, as expeditiously as possible, at any rate, within a period of 6 months from the date of receipt of a copy of this order. Crl.M.Cs. are disposed of. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS, JUDGE. Pn
